Daf ShevuiRava disagrees. Shimon accepted responsibility that he would pay back Reuven if someone made a claim against Shimon and based on that claim, distrained the property from Reuven. But Shimon did not mean to accept responsibility if someone wanted to claim a debt from Reuven himself! After all, Reuven should not benefit from the guarantee that Shimon gave him—it is merely a protection so that he does not lose out. Therefore, Shimon need not pay back Reuven.
